question: All the new students were given one minute to _____ introduce themselves to the whole class.
Everyone in the office must attend the meeting tomorrow. There are no _____ allowed.
To make fresh lemonade, cut the lemon in half, _____ the juice into a bowl, and then add as much water and sugar as you like.
Buddhism is the _____ religion in Thailand, with 90% of the total population identified as Buddhists.
When I open a book, I look first at the table of _____ to get a general idea of the book and to see which chapters I might be interested in reading.
The children were so _____ to see the clown appear on stage that they laughed, screamed, and clapped their hands happily.
Typhoon Maggie brought to I-lan County a huge amount of rainfall, much greater than the _____ rainfall of the season in the area.
His dark brown jacket had holes in the elbows and had _____ to light brown, but he continued to wear it.
Everyone in our company enjoys working with Jason. He’s got all the qualities that make a _____ partner.
Eyes are sensitive to light. Looking at the sun _____ could damage our eyes.
We were forced to _____ our plan for the weekend picnic because of the bad weather.
Three people are running for mayor. All three _____ seem confident that they will be elected, but we won’t know until the outcome of the election is announced.
If you _____ a traffic law, such as drinking and driving, you may not drive for some time.
Applying to college means sending in applications, writing study plans, and so on. It’s a long _____, and it makes students nervous.
Dr. Chu’s speech on the new energy source attracted great _____ from the audience at the conference.
The ending of the movie did not come as a _____ to John because he had already read the novel that the movie was based on.
Jack is very proud of his fancy new motorcycle. He has been _____ to all his friends about how cool it looks and how fast it runs.
The ideas about family have changed _____ in the past twenty years. For example, my grandfather was one of ten children in his family, but I am the only child.
The chairperson of the meeting asked everyone to speak up instead of _____ their opinions among themselves.
Although Mr. Chen is rich, he is a very _____ person and is never willing to spend any money to help those who are in need.
If you want to know what your dreams mean, now there are websites you can visit to help you _____ them.
The memory _____ of the new computer has been increased so that more information can be stored.
In order to stay healthy and fit, John exercises _____. He works out twice a week in a gym.
Traveling is a good way for us to _____ different cultures and broaden our horizons.
The story about Hou-I shooting down nine suns is a well-known Chinese _____, but it may not be a true historical event.
According to recent research, children under the age of 12 are generally not _____ enough to recognize risk and deal with dangerous situations.
Helen let out a sigh of _____ after hearing that her brother was not injured in the accident.
Research suggests that people with outgoing personalities tend to be more _____, often expecting that good things will happen.
No one could beat Paul at running. He has won the running championship _____ for three years.
If you fly from Taipei to Tokyo, you’ll be taking an international, rather than a _____ flight.
It rained so hard yesterday that the baseball game had to be _____ until next Saturday.
The book is not only informative but also _____, making me laugh and feel relaxed while reading it.
After working in front of my computer for the entire day, my neck and shoulders got so _____ that I couldn’t even turn my head.
Getting a flu shot before the start of flu season gives our body a chance to build up protection against the _____ that could make us sick.
The kingdom began to _____ after the death of its ruler, and was soon taken over by a neighboring country.
Though Kevin failed in last year’s singing contest, he did not feel _____. This year he practiced day and night and finally won first place in the competition.
Emma and Joe are looking for a live-in babysitter for their three-year-old twins, one who knows how to cook. _____.
As more people rely on the Internet for information, it has _____ newspapers as the most important source of news.
Having saved enough money, Joy _____ two trips for this summer vacation, one to France and the other to Australia.
Since I do not fully understand your proposal, I am not in the position to make any _____ on it.
Betty was _____ to accept her friend’s suggestion because she thought she could come up with a better idea herself.
The bank tries its best to attract more customers. Its staff members are always available to provide _____ service.
John’s part-time experience at the cafeteria is good _____ for running his own restaurant.
Women’s fashions are changing _____: One season they may favor pantsuits, but the next season they may prefer miniskirts.
Standing on the seashore, we saw a _____ of seagulls flying over the ocean before they glided down and settled on the water.
Lost and scared, the little dog _____ along the streets, looking for its master.
Residents are told not to dump all household waste _____ into the trash can; reusable materials should first be sorted out and recycled.
Kevin had been standing on a ladder trying to reach for a book on the top shelf when he lost his _____ and fell to the ground.
If student enrollment continues to drop, some programs at the university may be _____ to reduce the operation costs.
People in that remote village feed themselves by hunting and engaging in _____ forms of agriculture. No modern agricultural methods are used.
The government issued a travel _____ for Taiwanese in response to the outbreak of civil war in Syria.
The baby panda Yuan Zai at the Taipei Zoo was separated from her mother because of a minor injury that occurred during her birth. She was _____ by zookeepers for a while.
On a sunny afternoon last month, we all took off our shoes and walked on the grass with _____ feet.
It is both legally and ______ wrong to spread rumors about other people on the Internet.
These warm-up exercises are designed to help people _____ their muscles and prevent injuries.
Mei-ling has a very close relationship with her parents. She always _____ them before she makes important decisions.
The restaurant has a _____ charge of NT250perperson.SothefourofusneedtopayatleastNT1,000 to eat there.
At the Book Fair, exhibitors from 21 countries will ______ textbooks, novels, and comic books.
Before John got on the stage to give the speech, he took a deep ______ to calm himself down.
Most young people in Taiwan are not satisfied with a high school _____ and continue to pursue further education in college.
Nowadays many companies adopt a _____ work schedule which allows their employees to decide when to arrive at work—from as early as 6 a.m. to as late as 11 a.m.
The angry passengers argued _____ with the airline staff because their flight was cancelled without any reason.
To _____ the new product, the company offered some free samples before they officially launched it.
I was worried about my first overseas trip, but my father _____ me that he would help plan the trip so that nothing would go wrong.
The recent cooking oil scandals have led to calls for tougher _____ of sales of food products.
John should _____ more often with his friends and family after work, instead of staying in his room to play computer games.
To prevent the spread of the Ebola virus from West Africa to the rest of the world, many airports have begun Ebola _____ for passengers from the infected areas.
To teach children right from wrong, some parents will _____ their children when they behave well and punish them when they misbehave.
To stick to a tight budget, Robert bought a more _____ LED TV instead of a fancy, expensive 3D TV.
David’s new book made it to the best-seller list because of its beautiful _____ and amusing stories.
The airport was closed because of the snowstorm, and our _____ for Paris had to be delayed until the following day.
The moment the students felt the earthquake, they ran _____ out of the classroom to an open area outside.
The _____ capacity of this elevator is 400 kilograms. For safety reasons, it shouldn’t be overloaded.
An open display of _____ behavior between men and women, such as hugging and kissing, is not allowed in some conservative societies.
When taking medicine, we should read the instructions on the _____ carefully because they provide important information such as how and when to take it.
Posters of the local rock band were displayed in store windows to promote the sale of their _____ tickets.
Many people try to save a lot of money before _____, since having enough money would give them a sense of security for their future.
In winter, our skin tends to become dry and _____, a problem which is usually treated by applying lotions or creams.
Benson married Julie soon after he had _____ her heart and gained her parents’ approval.
The recent flood completely _____ my parents’ farm. The farmhouse and fruit trees were all gone and nothing was left.
The results of this survey are not reliable because the people it questioned were not a typical or _____ sample of the entire population that was studied.
In line with the worldwide green movement, carmakers have been working hard to make their new models more _____ friendly to reduce pollution.
Maria didn’t want to deliver the bad news to David about his failing the job interview. She herself was quite _____ about it.
The newcomer speaks with a strong Irish _____; he must be from Ireland.
Although Maggie has been physically _____ to her wheelchair since the car accident, she does not limit herself to indoor activities.
All passengers riding in cars are required to fasten their seatbelts in order to reduce the risk of _____ in case of an accident.
The principal of this school is a man of exceptional _____. He sets aside a part of his salary for a scholarship fund for children from needy families.
The science teacher always _____ the use of the laboratory equipment before she lets her students use it on her own.
Most of the area is covered by woods, where bird species are so _____ that it is a paradise for birdwatchers.
In most cases, the committee members can reach agreement quickly. _____, however, they differ greatly in opinion and have a hard time making decisions.
John’s clock is not functioning _____. The alarm rings even when it’s not set to go off.
The clouds parted and a _____ of light fell on the church, through the windows, and onto the floor.
Instead of a gift, Tim’s grandmother always _____ some money in the birthday card she gave him.
While winning a gold _____ is what every Olympic athlete dreams of, it becomes meaningless if it is achieved by cheating.
The thief went into the apartment building and stole some jewelry. He then _____ himself as a security guard and walked out the front gate.
Due to numerous accidents that occurred while people were playing Pokémon GO, players were advised to be _____ of possible dangers in the environment.
Sherlock Holmes, a detective in a popular fiction series, has impressed readers with his amazing powers of _____ and his knowledge of trivial facts.
Michael has decided to _____ a career in physics and has set his mind on becoming a professor.
Peter plans to hike in a _____ part of Africa, where he might not meet another human being for days.
People in this community tend to _____ with the group they belong to, and often put group interests before personal ones.
I mistook the man for a well-known actor and asked for his autograph; it was really _____.
After spending most of her salary on rent and food, Amelia _____ had any money left for entertainment and other expenses.
In the Bermuda Triangle, a region in the western part of the North Atlantic Ocean, some airplanes and ships were reported to have mysteriously disappeared without a _____.
Shouting greetings and waving a big sign, Tony _____ the passing shoppers to visit his shop and buy the freshly baked bread.
With a continuous 3 km stretch of golden sand, the beach attracts artists around the world each summer to create amazing _____ with its fine soft sand.
Mangoes are a _____ fruit here in Taiwan; most of them reach their peak of sweetness in July.
The interviewees were trying very hard to _____ the interviewers that they were very capable and should be given the job.
After the first snow of the year, the entire grassland disappeared under a _____ of snow.
Peter likes books with wide _____, which provide him with enough space to write notes.
At the beginning of the semester, the teacher told the students that late assignments would receive a low grade as a _____.
Various studies have been _____ in this hospital to explore the link between a high-fat diet and cancer.
Intense, fast-moving fires raged across much of California last week. The _____ firestorm has claimed the lives of thirty people.
Writing term papers and giving oral reports are typical course _____ for college students.
If we work hard to _____ our dreams when we are young, we will not feel that we missed out on something when we get old.
Few people will trust you if you continue making _____ promises and never make efforts to keep them.
Becky _____ her ankle while she was playing tennis last week. Now it still hurts badly.
Research shows that men and women usually think differently. For example, they have quite different _____ about what marriage means in their life.
The new manager is very _____. For instance, the employees are given much shorter deadlines for the same tasks than before.
While the couple were looking _____ for their missing children, the kids were actually having fun in the woods nearby.
After delivering a very powerful speech, the award winner was _____ by a group of fans asking for her signature.
Bobby cared a lot about his _____ at home and asked his parents not to go through his things without his permission.
The _____ costume party, held every September, is one of the biggest events of the school year.
In a job interview, attitude and personality are usually important _____ that influence the decision of the interviewers.
The snow-capped mountain is described so _____ in the book that the scene seems to come alive in front of the reader’s eyes.
Surrounded by flowers blooming and birds _____ merrily, the Wangs had a good time hiking in the national park.
It is essential for us to maintain constant _____ with our friends to ensure that we have someone to talk to in times of need.
The young generation in this country has shown less interest in factory work and other _____ labor jobs, such as house construction and fruit picking.
The new manager is a real gentleman. He is kind and humble, totally different from the former manager, who was _____ and bossy.
The weather bureau _____ that the typhoon would bring strong winds and heavy rains, and warned everyone of the possible danger.
Different airlines have different _____ for carry-on luggage, but many international airlines limit a carry-on piece to 7 kilograms.
Many people were happy that the government had finally _____ Children’s Day as a national holiday.
To reach the goal of making her company a market leader, Michelle _____ a plan to open ten new stores around the country this year.
Silence in some way is as _____ as speech. It can be used to show, for example, disagreement or lack of interest.
This TV program is designed for children, _____ for those under five. It contains no violence or strong language.
Tommy, please put away the toys in the box, or you might _____ on them and hurt yourself.
After hours of discussion, our class finally reached the _____ that we would go to Hualien for our graduation trip.
The candy can no longer be sold because it was found to contain artificial ingredients far beyond the _____ level.
Jack’s excellent performance in last week’s game has _____ all the doubts about his ability to play on our school basketball team.
It is bullying to _____ a foreign speaker’s accent. No one deserves to be laughed at for their pronunciation.
Mary lost ten kilograms in three months, so her _____ skin-tight jeans are now hanging off her hips.
The police officer showed us pictures of drunk driving accidents to highlight the importance of staying _____ on the road.
The claim that eating chocolate can prevent heart disease is _____ because there is not enough scientific evidence to support it.
Jane _____ her teacher by passing the exam with a nearly perfect score; she almost failed the course last semester.
The vacuum cleaner is not working. Let’s send it back to the _____ to have it inspected and repaired.
Due to the global financial crisis, the country’s exports _____ by 40 percent last month, the largest drop since 2000.
The potato chips have been left uncovered on the table for such a long time that they no longer taste fresh and _____.
The townspeople built a _____ in memory of the brave teacher who sacrificed her life to save her students from a burning bus.
The students in Professor Smith’s classical Chinese class are required to _____ poems by famous Chinese poets.
Although Mr. Tang claims that the house belongs to him, he has not offered any proof of _____.
Ancient Athens, famous for its early development of the democratic system, is often said to be the _____ of democracy.
Tom is really a naughty boy. He likes to _____ and play jokes on his younger sister when their parents are not around.
The 2011 Nobel Peace Prize was awarded _____ to three women for the efforts they made in fighting for women’s rights.
The company is _____ and making great profits under the wise leadership of the chief executive officer.
It is absolutely _____ to waste your money on an expensive car when you cannot even get a driver’s license.
The problem of illegal drug use is very complex and cannot be traced to merely one _____ reason.
The non-profit organization has _____ $1 million over five years to finance the construction of the medical center.
One week after the typhoon, some bridges were finally opened and bus service _____ in the country’s most severely damaged areas.
Elderly shoppers in this store are advised to take the elevator rather than the _____, which may move too fast for them to keep their balance.
Upon hearing its master’s call, the dog wagged its tail, and followed her out of the room _____.
Since many of our house plants are from humid jungle environments, they need _____ air to keep them green and healthy.
The skydiver managed to land safely after jumping out of the aircraft, even though her _____ failed to open in midair.
The invention of the steam engine, which was used to power heavy machines, brought about a _____ change in society.
To encourage classroom _____, the teacher divided the class into groups and asked them to solve a problem together with their partners.
Lisa _____ onto the ground and injured her ankle while she was playing basketball yesterday.
Hundreds of residents received free testing _____ from the city government to find out if their water contained any harmful chemicals.
When Jeffery doesn’t feel like cooking, he often orders pizza online and has it ______ to his house.
With pink cherry blossoms blooming everywhere, the valley ______ like a young bride under the bright spring sunshine.
Jane is the best ______ I have ever had. I cannot imagine running my office without her help.
The temple celebrated Mazu Festival by hosting ten days of lion dances, Taiwanese operas, and traditional hand ______ shows.
The new vaccine was banned by the Food and Drug Administration due to its _______ fatal side effects.
______ the photos with dates and keywords help you sort them easily in your file.
An ______ person is usually pleasant and easy to get along with, but don’t expect that he or she will always say “yes” to everything.
Hidden deep in a small alley among various tiny shops, the entrance of the Michelin star restaurant is barely ______ to passersby.
The original budget for my round-island trip was NT$5,000, but the ______ cost is likely to be 50 percent higher.
After watching a TV program on natural history, Adam decided to go on a ______ for dinosaur fossils in South Dakota.
The bus driver often complains about chewing gum found under passenger seats because it is ______ and very hard to remove.
Studies show that the unbiased media are in fact often deeply influenced by political ideology.
Jesse is a talented model. He can easily adopt an elegant ______ for a camera shoot.
In order to draw her family tree, Mary tried to trace her ______ back to their arrival in North America.
Upon the super typhoon warning, Nancy rushed to the supermarket—only to find the shelves almost ______ and the stock nearly gone.
Even though Jack said “Sorry!” to me in person, I did not feel any ______ in his apology.
My grandfather has astonishing powers of ______. He can still vividly describe his first day at school as a child.
Recent research has found lots of evidence to ______ the drug company’s claims about its “miracle” tablets for curing cancer.
Corrupt officials and misguided policies have ______ the country’s economy and burdened its people with enormous foreign debts.
As a record number of fans showed up for the baseball final, the highways around the stadium were ______ with traffic all day.
People who desire a ______ figure should exercise regularly and maintain healthy eating habits.
David felt disappointed when he found out that he could not choose his study partners, but would be ______ placed in a study group.
Watching the sun ______ from a sea of clouds is a must-do activity for all visitors to Ali Mountain.
Do you know what time the next bus is ______? I’ve been waiting here for more than 30 minutes.
The roasting heat and high ______ made me feel hot and sticky, no matter what I did to cool off.
Artwork created by truly great artists such as Picasso and Monet will no doubt ______ the test of time.
In some countries, military service is ______ for men only; women do not have to serve in the military.
The team complained that its leader always took the ______ for all the hard work done by the team members.
Located at the center of the city, the business hotel ______ not only good service but also convenient public transport.
As blood supplies have fallen to a critically low level, many hospitals are making an ______ for the public to donate blood.
If you put a ______ under a leaking faucet, you will be surprised at the amount of water collected in 24 hours.
The manager of the company was sued for ______ abusing his colleagues, calling them “hopeless losers.”
The local farmers’ market is popular as it offers a variety of fresh seasonal ______ to people in the community.
As the years have passed by, many of my childhood memories are already _____; I can no longer recall clearly what happened back then.
Racist remarks are by nature ______ and hurtful, and should be avoided on all occasions.
Not satisfied with the first ______ of her essay, Mary revised it several times before turning it in to the teacher.
Left ______ for years, the deserted house was filled with a thick coating of dust and a smell of old damp wood.
The high school student showed ______ courage when she helped the old man escape from the fire.
Publicly financed projects are often ______ or delayed during tough economic times due to a lack of resources.
Despite his busy schedule, the President ______ the school’s graduation ceremony with his presence and a heartwarming speech.
I called the airline to ______ my flight reservation a week before I left for Canada.
Jane usually buys things on ______. Her purchases seem to be driven by some sudden force or desire.
The week-long rainfall has ______ landslides and flooding in the mountain areas.
In the cross-lake swimming race, a boat will be ______ in case of an emergency.
The ground is slippery. Hold onto the rope and don’t ______.
______ the weather, the athletic meetings will be held on time.
If people keep polluting the rivers, no fish there will survive ______.
In order to write a report on stars, we decided to ______ the stars in the sky every night.
Julie wants to buy a ______ computer so that she can carry it around when she travels.
My grandmother likes to surprise people. She never calls ______ to inform us of her visits.
As the tallest building in the world, Taipei 101 has become a new ______ of Taipei City.
Many scholars and experts from all over the world will be invited to attend this yearly ______ on drug control.
John had failed to pay his phone bills for months, so his telephone was ______ last week.
The organic food products are made of natural ingredients, with no ______ flavors added.
Jessica is a very religious girl; she believes that she is always ______ supported by her god.
As computers are getting less expensive, they are _____ used in schools and offices today.
The drug dealer was ________ by the police while he was selling cocaine to a high school student.

Without much contact with the outside world for many years, John found many technological invention _____ to him.
The medicine you take for a cold may cause _____; try not to drive after you take it.
To gain more ______, some legislators would get into violent physical fights so that they may appear in TV news reports.

Mr. Chang always tries to answer all questions from his students. He will not _____ any of them even if they may sound stupid.
Irene does not throw away used envelopes. She _____ them by using them for taking telephone messages.
Cheese, powdered milk, and yogurt are common milk _____.
Although he is a chef, Roberto _____ cooks his own meals.
Due to the yearly bonus system, the 100 ________ positions in this high-tech company have attracted many applicants from around the island.
If you want to borrow magazines, tapes, or CDs, you can visit the library. They are all ______ there.
The fire in the fireworks factory in Changhua set off a series of powerful _________ and killed four people.
A good government official has to ________ the temptation of money and make the right decision.
If we can _____ to, we will take a vacation abroad in the summer.
Jerry didn’t _____ his primary school classmate Mary until he listened to her self-introduction.
With the completion of several public _____ projects, such as the MRT, commuting to work has become easier for people living in the suburbs.
With a good _____ of both Chinese and English, Miss Lin was assigned the task of oral interpretation for the visiting American delegation.
I am studying so hard for the forthcoming entrance exam that I do not have the_____ of a free weekend to rest.
Kim was completely _____ after jogging in the hot sun all afternoon; she had little energy left.
When Jason failed to pay his bill, the network company_______ his Internet connection.
A _____ mistake found in parenthood is that parents often set unrealistic goals for their children.
Some words, such as “sandwich” and “hamburger,” were _____ the names of people or even towns.
Have you ever _____ how the ancient Egyptians created such marvelous feats of engineering as the pyramids?
Mr. Johnson was disappointed at his students for having a passive learning _____.
Anne dreaded giving a speech before three hundred people; even thinking about it made her _____.
I had to _____ Jack’s invitation to the party because it conflicted with an important business meeting.
Selling fried chicken at the night market doesn’t seem to be a decent business, but it is actually quite _____.
The passengers _____ escaped death when a bomb exploded in the subway station, killing sixty people.
The movie director adapted this year’s bestseller into a hit and made a _____.
It’s a pity that you have to leave so soon. I _____ hope that you will come back very soon.
We human beings may live without clothes, but food and air are _____ to our life.
The manager _____ without hesitation after he had been offered a better job in another company.
Many important legal _____ concerning the tragic incident have now been preserved in the museum.
I’m not sure exactly how much scholarship you’ll receive, but it will _____ cover your major expenses.
Tom was very ill a week ago, but now he looks healthy. We are _____ by his quick recovery.
Wang Chien-ming, the Yankees’ best pitcher last year, already showed his great _____ for baseball when he was still a teenager.
Although Jeffery had to keep two part-time jobs to support his family, he never _____ his studies. In fact, he graduated with honors.
If it is too cold in this room, you can _____ the air conditioner to make yourself feel comfortable.
This course will provide students with a solid _____ for research. It is highly recommended for those who plan to go to graduate school.
Peter is now living on a _____ of NT$100 per day. He cannot afford any recreational activities.
Amy succeeded in _____ for a raise though her boss didn’t agree to increase her salary at first.
Ms. Li’s business _____ very quickly. She opened her first store two years ago; now she has fifty stores all over the country.
Ruth is a very _____ person. She cannot take any criticism and always finds excuses to justify herself.
Amy did not _____ changes in the course schedule and therefore missed the class.
Simon loves his work. To him, work always comes first, and family and friends are _____.
Although your plans look good, you have to be _____ and consider what you can actually do.
Built under the sea in 1994, the _____ between England and France connects the UK more closely with mainland Europe.
This tour package is very appealing, and that one looks _____ attractive. I don’t know which one to choose.
Hseu Fang-yi, a young Taiwanese dancer, recently _____ at Lincoln Center in New York and won a great deal of praise.
The police searched the house of the suspect _____. They almost turned the whole house upside down.
It is not easy for old people to _____ their backs, so they need help when their backs itch.
Mary is suffering from a stomachache and needs to eat food which is easy to _____.
Since our classroom is not air-conditioned, we have to _____ the heat during the hot summer days.
Sue is so _____ that she always breaks something when she is shopping at a store.
Ann enjoyed going to the flower market. She believed that the _____ of flowers refreshed her mind.
The profits of Prince Charles’s organic farm go to _____ to help the poor and the sick.
Jack was given the rare _____ of using the president’s office, which made others quite jealous.
This new computer is obviously _____ to the old one because it has many new functions.
Steve’s description of the place was so _____ that I could almost picture it in my mind.
With the worsening of global economic conditions, it seems wiser and more _____ to keep cash in the bank rather than to invest in the stock market.
Under the _____ of newly elected president Barack Obama, the US is expected to turn a new page in politics and economy.
Rapid advancement in motor engineering makes it _____ possible to build a flying car in the near future.
When you take photos, you can move around to shoot the target object from different _____.
Students were asked to _____ or rewrite their compositions based on the teacher’s comments.
Besides lung cancer, another _____ of smoking is wrinkles, a premature sign of aging.
When people feel uncomfortable or nervous, they may _____ their arms across their chests as if to protect themselves.
The doors of these department stores slide open _____ when you approach them. You don’t have to open them yourself.
Nicole is a _____ language learner. Within a short period of time, she has developed a good command of Chinese and Japanese.
With rising oil prices, there is an increasing _____ for people to ride bicycles to work.
This information came from a very _____ source, so you don’t have to worry about being cheated.
We hope that there will be no war in the world and that all people live in peace and _____ with each other.
To have a full discussion of the issue, the committee spent a whole hour _____ their ideas at the meeting.
While adapting to western ways of living, many Asian immigrants in the US still try hard to _____ their own cultures and traditions.
Mr. Lin is a very ________ writer; he publishes at least five novels every year.
Studies show that asking children to do house _____, such as taking out the trash or doing the dishes, helps them grow into responsible adults.
John has been scolded by his boss for over ten minutes now. _____, she is not happy about his being late again.
Since the orange trees suffered _____ damage from a storm in the summer, the farmers are expecting a sharp decline in harvests this winter.
Typhoon Morakot claimed more than six hundred lives in early August of 2009, making it the most serious natural _____ in Taiwan in recent decades.
Robert was the only _____ to the car accident. The police had to count on him to find out exactly how the accident happened.
Badly injured in the car accident, Jason could _____ move his legs and was sent to the hospital right away.
Mr. Lin is a very ______ writer; he publishes at least five novels every year.
Using a heating pad or taking warm baths can sometimes help to _____ pain in the lower back.
Due to ______, prices for daily necessities have gone up and we have to pay more for the same items now.
The government is doing its best to _____ the cultures of the tribal people for fear that they may soon die out.
I could not ______ the sweet smell from the bakery, so I walked in and bought a fresh loaf of bread.
Steve has several meetings to attend every day; therefore, he has to work on a very _____ schedule.
Michael Phelps, an American swimmer, broke seven world records and won eight gold medals in men’s swimming _____ in the 2008 Olympics.
Those college students work at the orphanage on a _____ basis, helping the children with their studies without receiving any pay.
The mayor has such a ______ schedule that it takes weeks to arrange an interview with her.
Jane started as an ______ art designer, but now she has a professional studio of her own.
The teaching ______ at the famous high school soon attracted more than a dozen well-qualified applicants.
Designed by a young engineer, the new product has created far more profit than ______ expected.
It has been confirmed that a balanced ______ of fruit and vegetables is a key element to good health.
As a shy boy afraid of making public appearances, Timmy ______ the thought of speaking before large audiences.
To the newly-crowned winner of the piano competition, music is his life’s ______, which he has devoted himself to whole-heartedly.
The drunk driver who shouted at passers-by and ______ them with glass bottles was quickly arrested by the police.
There were so many people at the bus station that I had to ______ my way through the crowd to board the bus in time.
Deadly shootings on US campuses have raised ______ concerns about how to prevent such tragic incidents from happening again.
